data.name: label1.Text
data.value:
User Manual This user manual provides detailed information and instructions on how to use the Prisoners Management System for Maula Prison. This system is designed to capture facial characteristics of inmates, conduct roll call, allocate new inmates in dormitories, show inmates who are near to be released and generate statistical reports. This manual covers the following topics:
1. System requirements 2. Installation 3. Login 4. Main menu 5. Inmate management 6. Roll call management 7. Dormitory management 8. Report generation 9. Troubleshooting
1. System Requirements * To use this system, you need: * A Windows-based computer with at least 4 GB of RAM and 500 GB of hard disk space * A webcam or a camera device that can connect to the computer * An internet connection 2. Installation * To install this system on your computer, follow these steps: * Insert the installation CD into your CD-ROM drive or download the installation file from the website. * Run the setup.exe file and follow the instructions on the screen. Accept the license agreement and choose the destination folder for the installation. Wait for the installation to complete and click Finish. 3. Login To access this system, you need to login with your username and password. Follow these steps: * Launch the system by double-clicking on the icon on your desktop or by selecting it from the Start menu. * Enter your username and password in the login screen and click Login. * If you have forgotten your password, click on Forgot Password and follow the instructions to reset it. * If you are logging in for the first time you will have to use your One-Time Password (OTP) to login, then you will need to change your password and follow the instructions to set a new password. 4. Main Menu After logging in, you will see the main menu screen at the left side bar that shows you different options to use this system. The main menu consists of eight buttons: * Dashboard: This is the landing page. * Inmate: This button allows you to manage inmate information such as adding new inmates, editing inmate details, viewing inmate history, searching for inmates by name or code, etc. * Visitors: This button allows you to manage visitations information such as adding visitations, editing visitor details, viewing visitor history, searching for visitors by name, etc. * Roll Call: This button allows you to conduct roll call using face detection technology. You can also view roll call history, feedback reports, attendance statistics, etc. * Dormitory: This button allows you to manage dormitory information such as adding new dormitories. * Users: This button allows you to manage user’s information such as adding new users, editing user details, viewing users, searching for visitors by name, etc. * Crimes: This button allows you to manage crimes information such as adding new crimes. * Reports: This button allows you to view statistical reports such as inmate’s population, roll call history.
